sub_topic: Predicting the products of inorganic reactions
message_1: What are the products formed when a barium nitrate (Ba(NO3)2) solution is mixed with a sodium sulfate (Na2SO4) solution? Show the balanced chemical equation and state whether the resulting mixture is aqueous or solid.
message_2:
When a barium nitrate (Ba(NO3)2) solution is mixed with a sodium sulfate (Na2SO4) solution, a double displacement reaction occurs. The products formed are barium sulfate (BaSO4) and sodium nitrate (NaNO3). Barium sulfate is a solid precipitate, while sodium nitrate remains in the aqueous solution. The balanced chemical equation for this reaction is:

Ba(NO3)2 (aq) + Na2SO4 (aq) â†’ BaSO4 (s) + 2 NaNO3 (aq)

In this equation, (aq) denotes an aqueous solution and (s) denotes a solid.
